Package task4

Class AlignString

java.lang.Object
task4.AlignString
class AlignString extends Object
The AlignString class performs reading a string from the command line and adding spaces so that the string length is equal to the given value. Spaces are added evenly between words (if possible).

  • Method Details

    • verifyArgs

      static void verifyArgs(String[] args)
      Verifies the passed args command line arguments.
      • If fewer or more than 2 arguments are passed, an error message is printed and the program is exited.
      Parameters:
      args - command-line arguments.

    • getLength

      static int getLength(String arg)
      Gets the required length of the aligned string from the passed arg command line argument, verifies it and returns it.
      • If the passed required length is less than or equal to zero, an error message is printed and the program is exited.
      Parameters:
      arg - command line argument with the required length of the aligned string;
      Returns:
      required length of the aligned string.

    • getString

      static String getString(int requiredLength, String arg)
      Gets the initial string from the passed arg command line argument, verifies it and returns it.
      • If the passed initial string starts or ends with spaces or is longer than the required length, an error message is printed and the program is exited.
      Parameters:
      requiredLength - required length of the aligned string;
      arg - command line argument with the initial string to be aligned;
      Returns:
      initial string to be aligned.

    • addSpacesToString

      private static String addSpacesToString(String[] wordArray, int totalSpacesNum)
      Adds spaces between words (if possible) evenly in the initialString.
      • If the string consists of a single word or none, spaces are added evenly at the start and end of the string.
      • If the string consists of several words, spaces are added evenly between each word.
      Parameters:
      wordArray - array of separate words from the initial string;
      totalSpacesNum - total number of spaces to be added to the string for alignment;
      Returns:
      string with added spaces evenly between words (if possible).

    • alignString

      static String alignString(int requiredLength, String initialString)
      Aligns the initialString by removing extra spaces and adding spaces evenly using the addSpacesToString method.

      The string is converted into a sentence with only one space between words by removing the extra spaces. Separate words are extracted from the generated string into an array. The total number of spaces to be added to the string to align it to the required length is calculated. To add spaces to a string for alignment, addSpacesToString method is called.

      Parameters:
      initialString - input string to be aligned;
      requiredLength - required length of the aligned string;
      Returns:
      aligned string.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Reads, aligns and prints a string.

      Reads the initial string and the required length of the aligned string from the command line. Validates the passed command line arguments. Aligns the initial string to the required length. Prints the required length, the initial string, the aligned string and the length of the aligned string.

      Parameters:
      args - command-line arguments.
